test
Class Series

java.lang.Object
  test.Series
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Series
extends Object
implements Serializable

Test series.

A test series is a group of related tests. A Series object provides the run method, which attempts to run all the tests in the series, and generates a test report.

Tests are generally run in the order in which they are provided. However, some tests may explicitly declare other tests in the series as prerequisites. Tests that declare prerequisites are run only after the prerequisites have completed successfully. Note that a test with prerequisites is not run in three cases: the prerequisite has failed, the prerequisite has itself not run, or the prerequisite is not included in the test series. The requirement that all prerequisites be explicitly included in the the test series is deliberate. The test series object notionally captures all the tests that will be run as part of the series.

Upon completion of a test series, the results are provided in a SeriesReport object. The SeriesReport object allows the results to be formatted and printed to an output stream.

The tests constituting a test series are provided as a list of classes. A test object is only instantiated immediately before the test is run. This ensures that it is possible to construct a test series even if the constructor of a test object would raise an exception - because test objects need not be constructed to construct a test series, only to run the test.

When running a test, the test series object creates a new thread. The thread constructs the test, and calls the test's initialize and perform methods. The test series object also starts a parallel timeout thread. The main test thread, any other threads started by it, and the timeout thread then race to call success or failure. The first call to either method determines the outcome of the test.

Once either method is called, the test series object creates a thread that calls clean on the test object, and a parallel cleanup timeout thread. The threads again race - this time to call cleanupSuccess or cleanupFailure. In the event of a cleanup failure, the test series has suffered a fatal error, and no more tests will be run, even if there are other tests for which all prerequisites have completed successfully. This is to prevent failures in those tests caused by unreleased system resources. A fatal error typically causes the process running the test series to stop the Java runtime, forcing the release of the system resources.

tests

private final Class<? extends Test>[] tests
List of tests making up this test series.

Constructor Detail

Series

public Series(Class<? extends Test>[] tests)
Creates a test series, given a list of test classes.

Parameters:
tests - List of test classes. This array is copied, so the original may be modified.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If tests is null, or if any of the elements of tests is null.
Method Detail

run

public SeriesReport run(int timeout,
                        PrintStream stream)
Runs the test series.

Tests are run in the order they were given to the Series constructor, subject to constraints imposed by test prerequisites.

Parameters:
timeout - Test timeout interval, in seconds. If a test fails to complete in this amount of time, it is considered to have timed out. Likewise, if a test fails to clean up in this amount of time, the cleanup process is considered to have failed. Note that a test can take twice this period to run: one period to time out the main test, and one more period to time out the cleanup process.
stream - Output stream to receive testing progress messages. Each message takes the form of the test class notice message, or a default replacement if the test class does not have a notice message. When the test is complete, either ok or failed is printed to the stream. If this argument is null, no progress printing is done.
Returns:
A SeriesReport object listing the tests that have succeeded, tests that have failed, and tests that were not run due to prerequisites that were missing or did not complete successfully.

run

private TestReport run(Class<? extends Test> test_class,
                       Timer timeout_timer,
                       int timeout)
Runs a single test.

This method performs the testing process, as explained in the class description.

Parameters:
test_class - Test class. The test object will be instantiated from this class.
timeout_timer - Timer object to be used for scheduling timeout tasks. This is created once in the public run method to avoid creating a new timer monitor thread every time a test is run.
timeout - Timeout interval. As described in the public run method.

notice

private static String notice(Class<? extends Test> test_class)
Retrieves the test notice string, if there is one, or returns a default notice otherwise.

This method access the public, static, final, non-null notice field of the given class, and if it is of type String, returns its value. If the field does not exist or does not meet these conditions, the method returns the string running [class name], where [class name] is the name of the test class.

Parameters:
test_class - Class for which the notice is to be retrieved.
Returns:
Notice string.

ready

private static boolean ready(Class<? extends Test> test_class,
                             List<Class<? extends Test>> successful_tests)
Checks that all of a test's prerequisites have been satisfied.

This method retrieves the value of the public, static, final, non-null prerequisites field of type Class[] in the given test class, if such a field exists. If the field does not exist, or does not meet these requirements, the empty array is used.

After obtaining the list of prerequisites in this manner, the method then proceeds to check whether each one is in the list of tests that have succeeded. If so, the method returns true. Otherwise, the method returns false.

Parameters:
test_class - Class for which prerequisites are to be checked.
successful_tests - List of tests classes that have already succeeded.
Returns:
true if prerequisites for the given test are satisfied, false if not.

staticField

private static <T> T staticField(Class<?> c,
                                 Class<T> field_type,
                                 String name,
                                 T default_value)
Retrieves the value of a static field in a class.

The field must be public, static, and final. It must have a type that is assignable to the given type, its name must match the given name, and it must not be null. If the given class has no such field, the method returns the given default value.

Parameters:
c - Class from which the field is to be retrieved.
field_type - Field type. The actual field type may be any type that is assignable to this t ype.
name - Field name.
default_value - Default value to be used if the actual field value cannot be retrieved.
Returns:
The value of the field, or the default value if a field matching the requirements cannot be found in the class.
